title: Epic: Documentation Lifecycle and Reorganization
description:
Establish clear documentation lifecycle and reorganize existing documentation to support sustainable growth. This epic addresses the current problem where docs/ mixes active guides, design specs, implementation records, and session notes (54 files), making it hard to find current documentation and unsustainable as more features are added.

## Problem Statement

Currently:
- 54 files in docs/ mixing active guides, historical records, session notes
- 20+ historical docs from before jit dogfooding (not linked to issues)
- No clear lifecycle for design docs (accumulate forever in docs/)
- Duplication (4+ docs on labels/hierarchy)
- Poor discoverability

## Solution: Three-Stage Lifecycle

1. **Active** (docs/design/) - Linked to in-progress issues
2. **Recent** (docs/design/) - Completed, kept 1-2 releases for reference
3. **Archived** (.jit/docs/archive/) - Moved after retention period

## Proposed Structure



## Archive Policy by Category

| Category | Archive? | When |
|----------|----------|------|
| User Guides | NEVER | Permanent, update in place |
| Architecture | RARELY | Only if major redesign |
| Development | NEVER | Permanent reference |
| Feature Designs | YES | 1-2 releases after completion |
| Bug Analyses | YES | Immediately after fix |
| Session Notes | YES | Immediately (or use issue context) |
| Visions | YES | When implemented/rejected |

## Benefits

1. Clean docs/ - only active/recent/permanent docs visible
2. Clear lifecycle - design doc → archive when done
3. Searchable history - jit search works in archives
4. Issue linkage preserved - archived docs still linked via jit
5. Scalable - won't accumulate 100s of files
6. Dogfooding - uses jit's document tracking
7. Consolidation - remove duplication (4+ label docs → 1)

## Scope

This epic will:
- Archive 20+ pre-jit historical docs to .jit/docs/archive/pre-jit/
- Archive 3 completed bug analyses to .jit/docs/archive/bug-fixes/
- Reorganize active docs into guides/design/architecture/development/vision/
- Consolidate duplicates (label docs, agent docs, gate docs)
- Create docs/README.md with archive policy and navigation
- Update root README.md links
- Remove obsolete docs (auth-design.md, billing-design.md)

## Out of Scope (Future)

- Automated archiving (jit doc archive command)
- Retrospective issues for pre-jit work
- Archive trigger automation

## Success Metrics

- docs/ reduced from 54 to ~25 active files (52% reduction)
- No duplicate content on same topics
- Clear navigation via docs/README.md
- Archive policy documented
- All internal links working
- Gate documentation complete and comprehensive

## Implementation Phases

See linked document for detailed 4-phase implementation plan:
1. Archive pre-jit historical docs (30 min)
2. Archive completed bug fixes (10 min)
3. Reorganize active docs into new structure (1 hour)
4. Consolidate duplicates and create navigation (1-2 hours)

Total estimated effort: 3-4 hours
